examples: The worm turns quickly in the world of politics.
She finally wormed the truth out of him.
Steve wormed his way out of going to the meeting.
I can only offer you a worm's eye view of the situation.
He always managed to worm his way out of doing the dishes.
words.defineEn: a small soft-bodied animal with an elongated body that lacks limbs and eyes
words.defineVi: một động vật thân mềm nhỏ với cơ thể thon dài không có chân tay và mắt

examples: Among today's animal phyla, the earliest to display segmentation is Annelida, which includes leeches, earthworms and lugworms.

Almost all of these are marine species, and they're really diverse, but the ones you've probably seen evidence of are the lugworms, the ones that dig holes at the beach and leave piles of castings on the sand.
words.defineEn: a sandworm that lives near the sea and is used as bait for fishing
words.defineVi: một con giun cát sống gần biển và được dùng làm mồi câu cá

examples: Now, just like most animals, earthworms have a front end and a back end.
Some people even keep earthworms in their garden on purpose!
Healthy earthworms means healthy soil!
And earthworms are hungry.
Earthworms need energy to wriggle through the soil.
words.defineEn: a terrestrial invertebrate of the annelid family that moves through the soil and feeds on organic matter
words.defineVi: một loài động vật không xương sống trên cạn thuộc họ annelid di chuyển trong đất và ăn các chất hữu cơ

examples: Centipedes are really methodical groomers.
But the house centipede still has legs to spare.
But house centipedes rarely bite people.
The centipede uses them as a lasso to keep its prey from escaping.
It’s voracious, venomous, and the fastest centipede there is.
words.defineEn: an arthropod with many pairs of legs and a pair of poisonous fangs
words.defineVi: một động vật chân đốt có nhiều cặp chân và một cặp răng nanh độc

examples: Sure, it’s just a flatworm at the bottom of a pond.
Then there’s flatworms, the group that includes tapeworms.
Ants are only one of this flatworm’s three hosts.
The flatworm genus Thysanozoon has uniquely evolved numerous waste-holes across the top of its body.
The ponds with the most malformed amphibians were also harboring an infection of trematodes, a type of flatworm, particularly one named Ribeiroia.
words.defineEn: a simple worm with a soft unsegmented body that is flat, some types of which are parasitic
words.defineVi: một loại giun đơn giản với cơ thể mềm, phẳng, không phân đốt, một số loại ký sinh

examples: Most millipedes curl up into a ball.
For Promecognathus crassus, millipedes are their favorite food.
Yep, this millipede is glowing.
This is a millipede.
Apheloriine millipedes produce hydrogen cyanide when they feel threatened.
words.defineEn: any arthropod of the diplopod family with a segmented body and many pairs of legs
words.defineVi: bất kỳ động vật chân đốt nào thuộc họ ngoại giao với cơ thể bị phân đoạn và nhiều cặp chân

examples: Tapeworms, for example, invade your intestines.
The oldest evidence of a tapeworm infection in a vertebrate comes from the Permian Period, around 270 million years ago.
Tapeworms are an infamous group of flatworms that get inside our intestines and set up shop stealing our nutrients and laying eggs.
Then there’s flatworms, the group that includes tapeworms.
But we’re not the only ones targeted by tapeworms.
words.defineEn: a parasitic flatworm that is shaped like a ribbon and lives in the intestines of mammals
words.defineVi: một loại giun dẹp ký sinh có hình dạng như một dải ruy băng và sống trong ruột của động vật có vú

words.defineEn: a long tiny nematode that infests the intestines, especially rectum, of mammals
words.defineVi: một loại giun tròn nhỏ dài xâm nhập vào ruột, đặc biệt là trực tràng, của động vật có vú

examples: Leeches have suckers on both ends of their body.
At hospitals like California Pacific Medical Center in San Francisco, leeches have made a comeback.
So what are leeches anyway?
But some leeches developed a taste for blood.
Doctors literally prescribe leeches to help a patient recover.
words.defineEn: a parasitic or predatory worm of the annelid family that lives in freshwaters and drinks blood by attaching itself to its prey
words.defineVi: một loài giun ký sinh hoặc săn mồi thuộc họ annelid sống ở vùng nước ngọt và uống máu bằng cách bám vào con mồi của nó

examples: Nematodes are major players in the carbon cycle.
Nematodes also share some of the same biological characteristics as humans.
First of all, what is a nematode?
Nematodes aren’t especially shy, either.
Some nematodes can be deadly.
words.defineEn: any long and cylindrical worm with a segmented body that is either parasitic or free-living
words.defineVi: bất kỳ con giun dài và hình trụ nào có cơ thể bị phân đoạn sống ký sinh hoặc sống tự do

examples: Caterpillars change into butterflies.
But caterpillars?
Caterpillar fungus grows in the remote Tibetan Plateau in the Himalayan mountains.
I love my caterpillar.
When an ant attacks, the caterpillar basically throws up on it.
words.defineEn: a long and small wormlike larva of a moth or butterfly that has many limbs
words.defineVi: một ấu trùng dài và nhỏ giống như con sâu của bướm đêm hoặc bướm có nhiều chi

words.defineEn: the larvae of a beetle that feed on wood and make a lot of holes in it
words.defineVi: ấu trùng của một con bọ ăn gỗ và tạo ra nhiều lỗ trên đó

examples: Some, like hookworms, compete with children's brains and bodies for nutrition, stunting growth, and impairing intelligence.
But when you actually read the article, you find out that they're talking about a protein produced by hookworms.
Like this one, bloodsucking parasitic hookworms could help make millions of people healthier.
words.defineEn: a parasitic roundworm with strong hooks or plates that attaches to an animal or a human's intestines and causes an infection or disease
words.defineVi: một loại giun tròn ký sinh có móc hoặc đĩa chắc chắn bám vào ruột của động vật hoặc người và gây nhiễm trùng hoặc bệnh tật

examples: Fortunately, the roundworm can be treated in dogs and raccoons using an oral deworming medication and a strict sanitizing regimine.
Raccoon roundworms should not be put in the same category as other roundworms, because raccoon roundworms are way worse for humans.
And if the raccoon eats the infected animal, the roundworms return to their host and continue with their life cycle.
Raccoon roundworms should not be put in the same category as other roundworms, because raccoon roundworms are way worse for humans.
Raccoon roundworms should not be put in the same category as other roundworms, because raccoon roundworms are way worse for humans.
words.defineEn: a worm of the nematode family that is parasitic and lives in the intestines of humans or animals
words.defineVi: một loại giun thuộc họ giun tròn ký sinh và sống trong ruột người hoặc động vật

examples: As their name implies, adult liver flukes live in the livers of grazing animals like cows.
Which is exactly what the Lancet liver fluke does to the ants it parasitizes.
So if they wanted to turn on or off specific regions, they’d have to get all up in there like a liver fluke does to an ant.
words.defineEn: any parasitic worm of the trematode family that invades the liver of a mammal
words.defineVi: bất kỳ loại giun ký sinh nào thuộc họ sán lá xâm nhập gan của động vật có vú

examples: Glowworms and certain deep-sea fish species are some of the creatures capable of producing and emitting light.

Spontaneous combustion of marsh or swamp gas, a rationale proposed at least as early as 1729 by W. Derham who, after observing the phenomenon over half a decade, directly refuted the hypothesis that the lights were caused by glowworms flying together.
words.defineEn: a type of insect, the female of which emits light through bioluminescence, especially a firefly
words.defineVi: một loại côn trùng, con cái phát ra ánh sáng thông qua phát quang sinh học, đặc biệt là đom đóm
